abstracts.cdata!:
This study assesses the impacts of
            municipal development projects (MDPs) on the institutional
            capacity building of local governments for fiscal and
            financial management and for planning and implementation of
            investment programs. It also assesses direct impacts on the
            beneficiaries as anticipated by the projects, and indirect
            side-effects on the development of local economies focusing
            on employment and income generation. The study evaluates the
            impacts of two successful MDPs, in the Philippines and in
            Brazil. They provide a rich base for the study to extract
            lessons for ongoing and future projects. Three sets of data
            were collected and analyzed: municipal finance data of local
            governments, a sample survey of mayors on capacity building,
            and a survey of stall-holders in public markets. At both the
            municipal and the beneficiary levels, the study compared
            impacts on the participating municipalities with conditions
            of the non-participating municipalities, and the initial
            conditions with the impacts after the project implementation.
